member.summary: Gets an instance to use for a given cryptographic key.

The initialization vector to use, when applicable.
true if encrypting; false if decrypting.
member.returns: An instance of .

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptographicEngine.IsValidInputSize(PCLCrypto.CryptographicKey,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks whether the given length is a valid one for an input buffer to the symmetric algorithm.
member.param: The length of the input buffer in bytes.
member.returns: true if the size is allowed; false otherwise.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.CryptographicEngine.BufferingCryptoTransform
member.summary: A crypto transform that can do no work incrementally, but does it all at the end.
member.remarks: Sadly, this is necessary because WinRT offers no incremental encryption/decryption APIs.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicEngine.BufferingCryptoTransform.bufferingStream
member.summary: The buffering stream.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicEngine.BufferingCryptoTransform.transform
member.summary: The transform to run when all bytes are collected.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptographicEngine.BufferingCryptoTransform.#ctor(System.Func{System.Byte[],System.Byte[]})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The transform to run when all bytes are collected.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.CryptographicEngine.CbcModeTransform
member.summary: Enables streaming crypto operations for CBC block modes.
member.remarks: WinRT lacks streaming encryption/decryption support. For certain block modes we can simulate the behavior. CBC is one of them.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicEngine.CbcModeTransform.inputIVFunc
member.summary: The cipher function to invoke (encrypt or decrypt). First arg is input buffer, second arg is IV.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicEngine.CbcModeTransform.blockLength
member.summary: The block length in bytes.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptographicEngine.CbcModeTransform.iv
member.summary: The initialization vector to pass to the next execution of the block.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The cipher function to invoke (encrypt or decrypt). First arg is input buffer, second arg is IV.

member.name: T:PCLCrypto.Formatters.Asn
member.summary: Encodes/decodes ASN.1 messages.
member.remarks: The ASN.1 format is documented here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X.690

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.Asn.ReadAsn1Elements(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of ASN.1 elements from a stream.
member.returns: A sequence of elements.
member.remarks: The stream may not contain exclusively ASN.1 data. This method will read the stream exactly one element at a time, and the caller should only enumerate as many elements as are expected to avoid reading into other data. If the end of the stream is reached, the sequence terminates.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.Asn.ReadAsn1Elements(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Reads a sequence of ASN.1 elements from a stream.
member.returns: A sequence of elements.
member.remarks: The stream may not contain exclusively ASN.1 data. This method will read the stream exactly one element at a time, and the caller should only enumerate as many elements as are expected to avoid reading into other data. If the end of the stream is reached, the sequence terminates.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.Asn.WriteAsn1Element(System.IO.Stream,PCLCrypto.Formatters.Asn.DataElement)
member.summary: Writes a single ASN.1 element to a stream.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.Asn.WriteAsn1Element(PCLCrypto.Formatters.Asn.DataElement)
member.summary: Returns a buffer containing an encoded ASN.1 element.
member.returns: The encoded ASN.1 element.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.Asn.WriteAsn1Elements(PCLCrypto.Formatters.Asn.DataElement[])
member.summary: Returns a buffer containing encoded ASN.1 elements.
member.returns: The encoded ASN.1 elements.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.Asn.GetMinimumBytesRequiredToRepresent(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets the minimum number of bytes required to represent an unsigned integer.
member.returns: The number of bytes [1-4] required to represent the value.

member.summary: Writes a key to the specified stream.

member.summary: Writes a key to the specified stream.
member.param: if set to true the private key will be written as well; otherwise just the public key will be written.

member.summary: Writes a key to a buffer.
member.returns: The buffer with the serialized key.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.KeyFormatter.Write(PCLCrypto.RSAParameters,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a key to a buffer.
member.param: if set to true the private key will be written as well; otherwise just the public key will be written.
member.returns: The buffer with the serialized key.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.KeyFormatter.Read(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads a key from the specified stream.
member.returns: The RSA key parameters.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.KeyFormatter.Read(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Reads a key from the specified buffer.
member.param: The buffer containing the key data.
member.returns: The RSA key parameters.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.KeyFormatter.PublicKeyFilter(PCLCrypto.RSAParameters)
member.summary: Returns an instance of that does not contain private key info.
member.param: The RSA parameters which may include a private key.
member.returns: An instance of that only includes public key information.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.KeyFormatter.NegotiateSizes(PCLCrypto.RSAParameters)
member.summary: Tries to add/remove leading zeros as necessary in an attempt to make the parameters CAPI compatible.
member.returns: The modified set of parameters.
member.remarks: The original parameters and their buffers are not modified.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.KeyFormatter.HasPrivateKey(PCLCrypto.RSAParameters)
member.summary: Determines whether a set of RSA parameters includes a private key.
member.returns: true if a private key is included; false otherwise.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.KeyFormatter.BufferEqual(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Checks whether two buffers have equal contents.
member.returns: true if the buffers contain equal contents.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.KeyFormatter.TrimLeadingZero(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Trims up to one leading byte from the start of a buffer if that byte is a 0x00 without modifying the original buffer.
member.returns: A buffer without a leading zero. It may be the same buffer as was provided if no leading zero was found.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.KeyFormatter.TrimOrPadZeroToLength(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Trims up to one leading byte from the start of a buffer if that byte is a 0x00 without modifying the original buffer.
member.param: The length to try to trim or pad to match.
member.returns: A buffer without a leading zero. It may be the same buffer as was provided if no leading zero was found.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.KeyFormatter.PrependLeadingZero(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a buffer with a 0x00 byte prepended if the buffer doesn't start with that byte.
member.param: if set to true a new buffer with a zero prepended will always be returned, even if the given buffer already has a leading zero.
member.returns: A buffer with the prepended zero.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.KeyFormatter.VerifyFormat(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception if a condition does not evaluate to true.
member.param: if set to false an exception will be thrown.
An optional message describing the failure.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.KeyFormatter.FailFormat(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an exception. For use during key deserialization.
member.param: An optional message describing the failure.
member.returns: Nothing. This method always throws.

member.summary: Reads a key from the specified stream.
member.returns: The RSA Parameters of the key.

member.summary: Writes a key to the specified stream.
member.param: The RSA parameters of the key.

member.summary: An identifier that the contents of this blob conform to the PRIVATEKEYBLOB specification.

member.summary: A byte indicating the blob version.

member.summary: A magic string: "RSA1"

member.summary: A magic string: "RSA2"

member.summary: A magic header that indicates key exchange use.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.CapiKeyFormatter.IsCapiCompatible(PCLCrypto.RSAParameters)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified RSA parameters can be represented in the CAPI format.
member.returns: true if CAPI is compatible with these parameters; false otherwise.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.CapiKeyFormatter.VerifyCapiCompatibleParameters(PCLCrypto.RSAParameters)
member.summary: Throws an exception if the specified RSAParameters cannot be serialized in the CAPI format.

member.summary: Reads a key from the specified stream.
member.returns: The RSA Parameters of the key.

member.summary: Writes a key to the specified stream.
member.param: The RSA parameters of the key.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.CapiKeyFormatter.CopyAndReverse(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns a copy of the specified buffer where the copy has its byte order reversed.
member.param: The buffer to copy and reverse.
member.returns: The new buffer with the contents of the original buffer reversed.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.CapiKeyFormatter.WriteReversed(System.IO.BinaryWriter,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a buffer to a stream in reverse byte order.
member.param: The data to copy, reverse and write to the stream. This buffer instance is not modified.
The number of bytes to write to the stream after the order reversal. A negative value means to copy the entire buffer.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.Formatters.CapiKeyFormatter.ReadReversed(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads data from a stream and reverses the byte order.
member.param: The reader to use to read from the stream.
The number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The buffer read from the stream, after reversing its byte order.

member.summary: Defines a stream that links data streams to cryptographic transformations.

member.summary: The stream that is read from or written to with each I/O operation.

member.summary: The crypto transform to use for each block.

member.summary: The read/write mode of this stream.

member.summary: Data that has not yet been transformed.

member.summary: Data that has been transformed but not flushed.

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.inputBufferSize
member.summary: The number of valid bytes in .

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.outputBufferSize
member.summary: The number of valid bytes in .

member.name: F:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.outputBufferIndex
member.summary: The index of the first valid byte in . This advances when Read is called with a smaller buffer than we have bytes available.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The cryptographic operation to use for transforming data.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.WriteTo(System.IO.Stream,PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform[])
member.summary: Creates a CryptoStream that can be used to write to the specified stream after passing through a series of transforms.
member.param: The ultimate stream to be written to.
The transformations to apply to the data before writing to .
member.returns: A CryptoStream instance.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.ReadFrom(System.IO.Stream,PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform[])
member.summary: Creates a CryptoStream that can be used to read from the specified stream, passing the retrieved data through a series of transforms before being read from this stream.
member.param: The ultimate stream to be read from.
The transformations to apply to the data after reading from .
member.returns: A CryptoStream instance.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.FlushFinalBlock
member.summary: Updates the underlying data source or repository with the current state of the buffer, then clears the buffer.
member.remarks: Calling the Close method will call FlushFinalBlock. If you do not call Close, call FlushFinalBlock to complete flushing the buffer. Call FlushFinalBlock only when all stream activity is complete.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.Chain(System.IO.Stream,PCLCrypto.CryptoStreamMode,PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform[])
member.summary: Creates a CryptoStream chain of transforms.
member.param: The ultimate stream to be read from or written to.
Whether to prepare for read or write operations to trigger the operations.
member.returns: The start of the chain of CryptoStreams.

member.name: M:PCLCrypto.CryptoStream.ChainWrite(System.IO.Stream,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator{PCLCrypto.ICryptoTransform})
member.summary: Creates a CryptoStream chain of transforms for writing streams.
member.param: The ultimate stream to be read from or written to.
An enumerator positioned just before the transform to create for the outer-most stream.
member.returns: The start of the chain of CryptoStreams.
